name: NPR
text:
Dr. Fauci says Americans need to "double down on public health measures" until a vaccine arrives — "which will be soon."

"If you're fighting a battle, and the cavalry's on the way, you don't stop shooting. You keep going until the cavalry gets here." https://t.co/Oorhif93RY

name: NPR
text:
Facebook says users saw hate speech about once in every 1,000 pieces of content they viewed on the site between July and September.

It's the first time Facebook has publicly estimated the prevalence of hate speech on its platform.
https://t.co/HfHk44AbQl

name: NPR
text: JUST IN: Georgia election officials have released a report on the hand recount of the presidential election, affirming Joe Biden maintains his lead in the state. https://t.co/PnDEbifLSX

name: NPR
text: RT @LouderThanARiot: Join us tomorrow for a conversation with @craftingmystyle about all things #LouderThanARiot. https://t.co/otaIdHtSjj

name: NPR
text:
There are fewer homes for sale in the U.S. now than ever recorded in nearly 40 years of data. It's a big part of what's pushing home prices up to record highs — and making homeownership unaffordable for so many.  
https://t.co/nGtggbmwhl
